bibl.title: assisted by Darren GLAZIER, The Ancient Red Sea Port of Adulis, Eritrea. Results of the Eritro-British Expedition 2004-5.
bibl.note: Historical Background and Previous Investigations (F.Gl. and D.P.), pp. 7-17. - Topographic and Geophysical Survey (D.Gl. et al.), pp. 19-32. - The Galala Hills (D.P. and L.Bl.), pp. 33-37. - The Ancient Shoreline and Maritime Landscape (L.Bl. and D.P.), pp. 39-56. - Survey of the Island of Deses (L.Bl. and D.P.), pp. 57-64. - Samidi (D.Gl. et alii), pp. 65-77. - Pottery from the Survey (D.P. et alii), pp. 79-108. - Stone Artefacts from the Survey (D.P.), pp. 109-124. - Review, Discussion and Conclusion (D.P., L.Bl. and D.Gl.). - Appendix: The Topography of Periplus Ports: A Comparison (D.P. and L.Bl.), pp. 135-139. - Bibliography.
bibl.seg: 241 Adoulis Mer Rouge 364 Periplus Maris Erythraei
PEACOCK David and Lucy BLUE (Edd.), assisted by Darren GLAZIER, The Ancient Red Sea Port of Adulis, Eritrea. Results of the Eritro-British Expedition 2004-5.
Oxford, Oxbow Books, 2007, ix-145 pp., figg. ISBN 978-1-84217-308-4. £30.

Historical Background and Previous Investigations (F.Gl. and D.P.), pp. 7-17. - Topographic and Geophysical Survey (D.Gl. et al.), pp. 19-32. - The Galala Hills (D.P. and L.Bl.), pp. 33-37. - The Ancient Shoreline and Maritime Landscape (L.Bl. and D.P.), pp. 39-56. - Survey of the Island of Deses (L.Bl. and D.P.), pp. 57-64. - Samidi (D.Gl. et alii), pp. 65-77. - Pottery from the Survey (D.P. et alii), pp. 79-108. - Stone Artefacts from the Survey (D.P.), pp. 109-124. - Review, Discussion and Conclusion (D.P., L.Bl. and D.Gl.). - Appendix: The Topography of Periplus Ports: A Comparison (D.P. and L.Bl.), pp. 135-139. - Bibliography.

C.R. par Alexis D'Hautcourt, The Kyoto Journal of Ancient History 8 (2008) pp. 79-86 [concerne aussi: David PEACOCK and David WILLIAMS (Edd.), Food for the Gods. New Light on the Ancient Incense Trade (Oxford, 2007); - René J. CAPPERS, Roman Foodprints at Berenike. Archaeobotanical Evidence of Subsistence and Trade in the Eastern Desert of Egypt (Los Angeles, 2006)].
